comments.body: I originally put this step in the end because I don't want to deter the reporter early on. In my opinion, this step is significantly harder and time consuming than other steps. Is there any particular reason that we have to put it upfront?
What would you do with a bug report where someone submitted a video of their giant app and a trace from that app, other than tell them "...could you provide a smaller test case"?

We usually fall back to item 1. "Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into.". For example, they may reference their own Github repo (which might be private). I've had that case with the hisotry of everything app by 2Dimensions.

How many of those can you handle each week? Even if we put step 2 in, we're still going to get tons of bugs that don't do it. If we don't put step 2 first, we'll have even more of them.

Given our bandwidth, I think it's best to optimize for the cleanest bugs we can get.
Sure, let's get the cleanest bugs :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@1.  Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into.

2.  Please attach a small application (ideally just one main.dart file) that
     reproduces the problem. You could use https://gist.github.com/ for this.
